newsitem.title: USA: Trading floors of the future may be virtual.
newsitem.headline: Trading floors of the future may be virtual.

text.p: The trading floor of the 21st century may be a virtual one, or may be a hybrid of today's open outcry and electronic trading, experts at the options industry conference said Friday.
"Computers and networks dominate our daily lives," Otto Nageli, chief executive officer of the Swiss Options and Financial Futures Exchange AG (SOFFEX), told the group. "This will not change."
He said trading floors "as we understand them are bound to disappear."
The SOFFEX experiment with electronic trading, which is about eight months old, has led to higher liquidity, larger volumes and smaller spreads and has turned opponents into proponents, Nageli said.
But electronic trading has eliminated the social component of trading, a major drawback, he said.
Moses Ma, a partner at Mitchell Madison Group management consultants, said the trading floor of the future will likely be a combination of electronic and open outcry.
In highly liquid markets, "products trade by themselves" and there is little need for an open outcry system, Ma said.
But in products where liquidity is tight, a market maker or specialist system is best.
"In future, we'll be somewhere in the middle" of these two types of trading systems, he said.
